attributes.action: Make 29th March a National Bank Holiday - Called Independence Day!
attributes.background: On the 29th March the UK will officially leave the European Union - This should be celebrated nationally with a bank holiday.
attributes.additional_details: After many decades being controlled through multiple European Union institutions, being unable to control our own trading policy, immigration system, waters and laws. On the 23rd June 2016, the United Kingdom voted to become a self governing country again - This will finally start to happen on March 29th 2019 - And it should therefore be celebrated.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for school toilets to have no soap, toilet paper, or locks
attributes.background: Currently I don’t believe it is illegal for schools to have insufficient hygiene standards in toilets. Many students avoid using toilets during school which can cause further health complications including kidney infections. This also encourages smoking, bullying, and vandalism.

attributes.action: Theresa May. NO bridge or new infrastructure to be built between UK and France
attributes.background: We sadly have the channel tunnel which people can still walk through. We the public do not want anymore tax payers money being spent on infrastructure, that joins us to france.We're an island and want to keep it that way for OUR safety.
attributes.additional_details: Boris Johnson on Thursday January 18th 2018 said he wants to now build a bridge to join the uk to france

attributes.action: Fund bus passes for 16 to 18 years olds who are still in full time education
attributes.background: Why does the government insists that our children stay in education until they are 18 but will not fund the transportation to get to sixth form or college after they leave school at 16.

attributes.action: Introduce a reassuring EM radiation limit for homes and schools (eg 1,000 µW/m2)
attributes.background:
There is no specific limit for mobile phone radiation in homes. We use the out-dated 1998 ICNIRP recommendation for incidental public exposure, which includes no risk management. 

Badly sited masts result in unnecessarily high levels which are never turned off and the health impact is unknown.
attributes.additional_details:
The World Health Organisation continues to rate this type of radiation as a Class 2b Carcinogen and many studies link it to childhood lukemia and other illnesses. Sufferers of electrosensitivity are also becoming increasingly common.

A phone network continues to work at 0.000002µW/m2 (source: powerwatch.org.uk). Before it stopped auditing it, over 10 years ago, the highest level Ofcom recorded inside a residence was 790µW/m2. Other countries have sensible limits without affecting reception.

attributes.action: Introduce prostate cancer screening
attributes.background: There are often no symptoms of prostate cancer until it has spread and its too late to cure. Many lives could be saved and it would save the NHS a fortune in expensive treatments.

attributes.action: Make teaching coping mechanisms compulsory in secondary schools
attributes.background: At 8 years-old I lost my mum to cancer, and I'd never dealt with it until 20 years later, because I wasn't equipped with adequate coping mechanisms. Children everywhere are unequipped to deal with trauma they experience on a daily basis, and the stress of later life, I'd like to change that.
attributes.additional_details: 1 in 4 British people suffer from mental health problems, and depression is 10x more widespread than it was just a decade ago (demonstrating its alarming growth under societal changes). 85% of adults experience stress on a regular basis; a cause of anxiety, depression, panic attacks and insomnia. Suicide is the biggest cause of death in men betweeh 20 - 49. And LGBT people are more likely to experience mental health problems, and less likely to have support systems.

attributes.action: childminders paid direct by the government for childcare element
attributes.background: Childminders are very important as they allow parents to go to work, the government pays the parents a percentage of the childcare costs, however childminders loose every month as parents use the money and don't pay our bills, we are left chasing parents for money that we have worked for
attributes.additional_details:
Childminders have a very demanding job, some of us work well over 60 hours a week as there is lots of paper work and planning to be done.  We are left with outstanding bill that parents don't pay and our own bills cant be paid as our wages are not paid by the parents
this is why they government should pay us directly instead of the money going to the parent

attributes.action: Combine the digital tachograph with the driver CPC (DQC) card
attributes.background: Currently you need a 5yr digital tachograph card to record your actions and the driver CPC card to prove you have completed 35h training over 5 years if you don't have your CPC card you will be fined £50.00 if you are driving commercial vehicles you need to have both with you a legal requirement
attributes.additional_details: Having trained hundreds of drivers and spoken to hundreds of transport managers everyone agrees there should be an alignment of both cards you need both to work and a simple alignment so you cannot get a digital card without completing 35h training

attributes.action: Ban energy drinks
attributes.background: My brother died August 2017 at the age of 25. We’re convinced this was due to drinking an excessive amount of energy drinks a day (up to 15). This increased his state of depression leading him to commit suicide. People should be aware of the risks these drinks can have, especially on young lives.
attributes.additional_details: Too much caffeine will keep you awake causing sleep deprivation. Caffeine has the ability to raise a person's blood pressure, energy drinks can contain up to 31mg of caffeine. Niacin is one of the main ingredients in Energy Drinks. Although it has its benefits, niacin can cause dizziness, and rapid heart rate. This cannot be good for anybody.

attributes.action: Do not rename the Second Severn Crossing as 'The Prince Of Wales Bridge'.
attributes.background: Many are unhappy that the bridge is to be named after The Prince Of Wales. This decision was made without any consultation with the Welsh people. A name of real significance to the Welsh should be chosen.

attributes.action: A total ban on hunting for sport including the digging out of foxes and badgers!
attributes.background: Hunting for sport in the 21st century is both barbaric and cruel. Just because it's tradition doesn't make it right! It's not just the wildlife that suffers, dogs and horses suffer as well!

attributes.action: Make public, communal eating space a legal requirement in high density housing.
attributes.background: A study found that regularly eating meals alone is the biggest single factor for unhappiness, besides existing mental illness. When we only design commercial spaces for individualised food consumption and cooking spaces for the single person, we are designing unhappiness.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that it should be a legal requirement for housing developments of any significant density, to provide large social eating spaces and communal kitchens, in which inhabitants can cook for one another, socialise and share food freely. This will avoid public health concerns such as social isolation.
 
https://www.theguardian.com/society/2018/may/23/the-friend-effect-why-the-secret-of-health-and-happiness-is-surprisingly-simple
 
foodhallproject.org

attributes.action: Scrap the charges for child arrangement applications
attributes.background:
Where a resident parent agitates or denies contact between non resident parents and their children, the process for an arrangement order demands the non resident parent pay costs of £215 after also having to pay for attempts at mediation.
The right to a family life should not be priced in this way.

attributes.action: Ban unsafe sleep products such as bumpers, sleep positioners and pillows
attributes.background: I lost a child due to SIDS and now want to spread awareness about the importance of safe sleep. New “sleep” products are hitting the market and new parents are fooled by their false claims. Using these products (sleep positioners, pillows, bumpers) can increase the risk of suffocation.
attributes.additional_details: There is sufficient evidence that babies have died as a consequence of using these products. They shouldn’t be allowed to be sold in the UK. There has been 2 infant deaths related to baby hammocks yet they are still sold. There have been cot bumper related deaths and they are banned in certain states in America . New studies show sleep positioners to be unsafe. Baby pods and nests should carry a warning that they are not safe for overnight sleep.

attributes.action: Stop non-UK residents donating money to UK political lobby groups.
attributes.background: Soros and others have their own agenda. People who don’t live in the UK should not be allowed to influence British politics by donating funds to lobby groups.

attributes.action: Undertake a thorough investigation into Northern (Rail) and their conduct
attributes.background:
Northern, in the views of many, fail to perform in almost every respect. 

Trains are regularly cancelled, delayed or don't have enough carriages. 

Their performance makes commuting and public transport in the north a misery and has huge implications on the economy and daily lives of millions.

attributes.action: Training for all teachers and doctors to identify autism in males and females
attributes.background: Austism presents differently in males and females that most girls get left undignosed and left flying under the radar, a failed generation and we need to change this. All doctors and teachers everywhere should have the training to recognise autism in both sexes.
attributes.additional_details: We need to stop letting these children/family struggle because no one really knows what we go through, especially if you are an autistic female who can mask her traits by observing and mimicking what other children do and giving eye contact when it comes to comunicating but this is very exausting to the autistic female, which results in meltdowns as soon as she gets home from holding herself together all day and being someone she's not, just because we are female we are thought not to have autism.

attributes.action: Abolish the 'Tampon Tax' once the UK has left the European Union.
attributes.background: The 'Tampon Tax' is currently at the lowest rate possible under EU's VAT rules. Once the UK has left the EU, there is an opportunity for the Government to abolish the 'Tampon Tax', therefore taking a step towards eradicating period poverty.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2017, Plan International UK found that 1 in 10 girls or women aged 14 to 21 in Britain cannot afford sanitary towels or tampons.
Period Poverty is a massive issue in the UK, and abolishing the 'Tampon Tax' would help to reduce the number of women and girls affected by it. Girls should not be missing school or using unsanitary items such as socks, tissue or newspaper, to avoid bleeding through their clothes.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of eggs from caged chickens
attributes.background: Keeping caged chickens is wrong as chickens are living animals and deserve to be treated fairly. As many trusted sources have confirmed, it is extremely bad for them - they can become overweight and ill and lead unhappy lives.
attributes.additional_details:
As Cambridge University has proven, keeping hens in cages results in a “higher incidence of metabolic disorders”, which means that the chickens are under severe risk of SDS (Sudden Death Syndrome). This disease costs the US alone 100 million dollars annually – surely you don't want to allow this to continue in the UK too?

Letting caged hens have their own space is critical, and if we don't act fast we will be condoning cruelty.

attributes.action: Make 5th March a national holiday in celebration of Mark E Smith (born 05/03/57)
attributes.background: Mark Edward Smith was a prolific and talented writer & performer in The Fall. Over 40 years he was the creative force behind the most original music/lyrics, documented in some 30+ studio albums, various Ep's, 66 singles & countless live, bootleg & complication albums.
attributes.additional_details: Best British writer ever. (Better than Shakespeare)

attributes.action: UK must ratify the optional protocol to the UN Rights of the Child Convention.
attributes.background: This important addition to the Convention gives members of the public and child sexual abuse victims the right to directly raise issues & complaints with the UN Committe on the Rights of the Child and its members. The majority of EU countries have ratified but the UK is conspicuous by its absence.
attributes.additional_details: The unratifed "communication" protocol  allows child sex abuse victims to raise complaints directly with the UN Committee in relation to public authorities failing to safeguard and protect children in relation to child sexual abuse after exhausting all internal remedies. That this protocol has not been ratified is bizarre given the UK's failings in this area.  Failings which have become somewhat of a daily news occurrence in recent years.  It would give individual abuse victims a voice at the UN.

attributes.action: Allow all the proceeds of ‘right to buy’ sales to be kept by the local authority
attributes.background: When right to buy council houses are sold there is no benefit to the local authority. If all proceeds of a right to buy sale were kept by the local authority the business case for new council housing is strong. Councils would build, the homeless would be housed, and funds earned for local councils.
attributes.additional_details:
When right to buy council houses are sold only a fraction of the price ever went to the local authority. This put an end to the building of new council housing. There is a clear local authority business case for building council housing: income generated will more than cover the costs, increasing revenues and reducing the need for cuts in other services. But the high chance that the tenant buys and all revenues go to central government destroys the business case.
See https://philhemsley.wordpress.com/2018/01/06/the-simple-change-to-government-budgeting-rules-that-could-solve-the-housing-problem/

attributes.action: Legislate so that for each creation of life peers, males do not exceed females
attributes.background: A Parliament that reflects the diversity of the population would be better able to represent the people. Every government since the 1950s has appointed twice as many male life peers than female. This needs to be addressed.
attributes.additional_details:
The proportion of women in the House of Lords (26%) is lower than in every other parliament and assembly in the UK. 
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/LLN-2018-0015

Legislation exists to seat female bishops as Lords Spiritual preferentially, to address historic gender discrimination. 
https://researchbriefings.parliament.uk/ResearchBriefing/Summary/LLN-2017-0056

attributes.action: Issue legal guidance that IVA completion certificates should be issued promptly
attributes.background: An IVA makes people live on a tight budget for 5 years in an effort to pay back what they can. These people can't start to rebuild their lives or their credit rating until they get their completion certificate. This currently takes months and sometimes over 6 months. We suggest it should be 30 days.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.iva.co.uk/iva-completion-certificates-petition

attributes.action: Ban the removal of non farmed fresh water course fish for use as food.
attributes.background: Fresh water fish are now on the decline due a number of reasons from Cormarants, Otters and people from Cultures where removal and eating of course fish is acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
As a lifelong angler along with many other friends we have noticed many rivers,ponds lakes ect around Lincolnshire and Yorkshire have started to see a large decline in fish populations.
To counteract and help towards this we aim to start this petition to stop humans taking course fish from any waters unless specifically bred for the table for the period of 10 years with then a revue on the progress.
We feel this gives fish stocks a slightly better chance to help halt the decline in many venues.

attributes.action: Reject any proposals to merge Christchurch with Bournemouth and Poole council
attributes.background: 84% of Christchurch already voted AGAINST the merge with Bournemouth and Poole in the recent postal vote.
attributes.additional_details:
negociations are still happening on weather to ignore the voters and merge anyway... Christchurch is my home town, and we voted, so our vote and our voices matter. if our vote is ignored then why even vote in the first place? 
The people of Christchurch have decided that we do NOT want to be merged with Bournemouth and Poole so sign this petition if you would like the Government and Parliament to reject any proposals that the councils be merged. Thank you.

attributes.action: Stop Myxomatosis killing wild Rabbits by developing a lifetime vaccine
attributes.background: Myxomatosis is cruel disease which millions of wild rabbits in the UK die from each year. It is not acceptable that such a disease is left unchecked due to it being released illegally in the UK in the 1950’s. Myxomatosis is pure torture for any wild rabbit infected.
attributes.additional_details: They suffer severe conjunctivitis that results in blindness, swelling in the head, ears, eyes and genitals, thick pus discharge from the nose (which makes it difficult to breathe), and lumps on the body for up to two weeks before they die; longer in many cases. Rabbits are sentient beings, who feel pain and suffer every bit as any other animal. I want the Government to actively discuss all the options open to it to combat/control this disease in the wild rabbit population.

attributes.action: Increase the amount of support given to sexual assault and rape victims.
attributes.background: 85000 women and 12000 men are raped every year, that is 11 every hour. 13% of women who are raped attempt suicide and 94% experience post- traumatic stress disorder within two weeks of the incident. I believe that all victims should be provided with support to guide them to living with the trauma.
attributes.additional_details: Misconceptions about false reporting have direct, negative consequences and may contribute to why many victims do not report it. I believe people should be better educated about the issues and people need to know about what they can do to help. Rapes do not always occur between strangers in dark alleys, 85 to 90 percent of victims know their attacker; this only makes it harder for victims to move on from the incident.

attributes.action: Introduce a charge for all foreign vehicles using roads in the UK.
attributes.background: Currently foreign registered vehicles pay no charges driving in the UK, unlike European countries where an equivalent tax is subsidised by toll road networks. This is unfair to UK motorists & operators. Instigating a familiar system (vignette) at point of UK entry, collection would be easy & cheap.
attributes.additional_details: Many foreign drivers avoid payment at tolls, such as Dartford Crossing (Kent), where lost revenue runs at £42,000,000  in cancelled penalty notices alone. Prosecutions for excess speed, failure to stop/report accidents etc. would improve as drivers/owners are held to account utilising data collected. UK Insurance customers would see a dividend as foreign registered vehicles in the UK seek registration, tax & insurance in accordance with UK legislation, improvinvg safety, and the environment.

attributes.action: Convert the EU Charter of Rights into UK law
attributes.background: The Charter of Fundamental Rights of the European Union is important to everybody. It gives people a voice to be heard. The Charter of Rights needs to be converted into UK law after leaving EU so that our rights as humans are fully protected both at home and abroad.
attributes.additional_details: EU Charter of Rights gives access to proper justice and proper freedom for all without partiality. The UK has had a good history on human rights and protection for its citizens both at home and abroad.

attributes.action: Local councils  to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.
attributes.background: The consumption of clean water is a basic human need and millions of plastic bottles end up in landfills or in oceans to be eaten by marine life then into the food chain and human beings. Ask Parliament to implement a legal duty for local councils to provide drinking fountains in towns and cities.
attributes.additional_details:
The evidence for the danger of the breakdown of plastic is overwhelming, 
both in terms of damage to the environment, the food chain and in human bodies. This is an unknown health hazard and any efforts to reduce the use of plastic will be beneficial.
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-43388870 
http://www.plasticpollutioncoalition.org/ 
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Plastic_pollution 
https://www.lifewithoutplastic.com 
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-42264788 
http://www.sciencemag.org/tags/plastic-pollution 
https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-018-03104-3 
https://plasticoceans.org/the-facts/ 
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/environment/2018/jan/25/new-network-of-water-refill-points-aims-to-reduce-englands-plastic-waste

attributes.action: Ban animals in circuses across England
attributes.background: Scotland has done it, why hasn’t Theresa May helped animals in England? It’s barbaric, outdated and starves animals of natural instincts.

attributes.action: Make pet owners responsibility for their pet’s microchip details when rehoming
attributes.background: If an owner has to rehome their dog or cat it should be partly their responsibility to notify their microchip provider that the pet has been rehomed and send them the new owners details. Similar to V5 for a car where both the new and old owners have to notify the DVLA. If not a fine can be issued
attributes.additional_details:
There needs to be better laws in place to make it the responsibility of BOTH the old and new owners to update the animals microchip details.
Based on figures from the Dogs Trust Up to 12 dogs a day face being Put to Sleep because their owners haven’t updated their dogs microchip details 
And a further study conducted by Dogs Trust has found a mere 9% of dog owners consider updating their dogs’ microchips post-move a priority, with sorting digital TV coming above this.

attributes.action: Hold an independent inquiry Health Service settlements
attributes.background: It has been reported that Virgin Care were handed almost £2 million in an out of court settlement by Surrey’s Clinical Commissioning Groups, NHS England and Surrey County Council in 2017. This is a gross misuse of public money, but no-one has resigned or been held accountable.
attributes.additional_details: Lessons deserve to be learnt from such losses of public money.

attributes.action: Call PM to condemn Israeli human rights violations against Palestinian children
attributes.background: Palestinian children are being systematically arrested and imprisoned in Israel. Usually accused with throwing stones, these children are taken forcibly, imprisoned and interrogated without their parents or lawyers. They are subjected to military law and can face up to 20 year sentences.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.facebook.com/ajplusenglish/videos/1103514446456728/

attributes.action: For schools to sing the national anthem
attributes.background: I believe the national anthem is a important part of our country values and traditions. I grew up hearing the song -shows great respect to our queen and monarchy. I feel there have been debates about this - I personally would not like the song to lose it's importance for our Country, Queen - God
attributes.additional_details: I believe the national anthem is a important part of our country it mentions our god - our queen and shows the world the importance of the  monarchy and the great respect we have for our country traditions and the queen and our fellow men and women who have lost their lifes for our country.This song holds a important place in England's traditions being sing at football and commonwealth games and like other countries we should sing our national anthem with pride - many share my views.

attributes.action: Fund a 24-hour suicide text line
attributes.background: Many people suffer from severe anxiety and may not feel comfortable making phone calls to crisis teams or suicide helplines so they avoid calling which could put them in danger. Text lines could be quicker, easier and more comfortable for younger people as well as people with severe anxiety.
attributes.additional_details: ‘The share of device owners saying they make at least one voice call a week has dropped down from 96% to 75% over the past three years, according to research carried out by Ipsos Mori for Deloitte.’ Taken from The Guardian. This shows people are using phone calls less and less so making 24 hour text lines may make more people reach it for help when they need it. Texting is quicker but it can also help people feel more comfortable with opening up so they could be more honest to get the help needed.

attributes.action: Make asking for sex or sexual acts for rent a criminal offence
attributes.background: UK landlords are using classified adverts to advertise 'Sex for Rent' arrangements, in which young, vulnerable, often homeless people are convinced into living with a landlord "rent" free, in exchange for sexual acts. This coercion cannot continue, particularly for those with no other choice.
attributes.additional_details:
This practice is effectively incitement to prostitution and should be classified as such under Section 52 of the Sexual Offenders Act 2003. 
(https://www.cps.gov.uk/legal-guidance/prostitution-and-exploitation-prostitution) 

For more information please watch this documentary:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/programmes/p05y93q5

 Or read these articles:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/bbcthree/article/d6ad2e6d-2c72-4a35-9281-daaeedf029ee
https://www.rt.com/uk/384580-sex-abuse-rent-tenants/

attributes.action: Scrap the tax on child support for victims of domestic abuse.
attributes.background: The Child Maintenance Service charges parents for utilising their managed service. The charge is in place to cut costs and encourage ex-partners to engage. Victims of domestic abuse shouldn't be punished financially because of an abusive ex-partner and, for safety, shouldn't be encouraged to engage.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Government are taxing victims of domestic abuse every month for using their safest method of receiving Child Maintenance. At present, 4% of what a parent is entitled to is taken by the Government despite no other option being available.
This year, legislation to tackle domestic violence and abuse will come before the House of Commons. This petition is calling on the Government to use this opportunity to scrap the tax on child support for victims of domestic abuse.

attributes.action: Take freight off our roads and onto an improved Railway Freight system.
attributes.background: Governments worldwide are making great strides to protect the environment, yet the pioneers of Rail travel ignore the benefits of an updated Freight system that would take thousands of lorries and vans off UK roads and motorways. Saving Billions of pounds in road repairs and accidents.

attributes.action: Give local authorities a legal duty of care towards those waiting for housing
attributes.background: My son Lee had leukaemia, while in remission he was waiting to be housed by our council who failed to house him in time. Lee then passed away at my home from catching influenza when he should have been isolated from the public. I was suing my council but lost as we could not have our case heard.
attributes.additional_details: My solicitor and barrister thought I had a good chance of succeeding if all my evidence was heard first which then we could have proved a case of negligence.  However, the court decided that the council had no duty of care so they wouldn’t listen to all the evidence. Please sign this petition for future cases. If councils had a legal duty of care towards those on their housing waiting lists ALL of the evidence in this and similar cases would be heard and not decided before! Please see Ref: Court of Appeal court 75 applicants no B3/2015/1289 dated 11th April 2017 Lilian Darby versus London borough of Richmond upon Thames

attributes.action: Return power over admissions to academy schools to local authorities
attributes.background: Currently UK academy schools are not bound by local authorities’ admissions decisions. They are regulated by the Education and Skills Funding Agency, which is slow to respond to local authorities’ issues with academy schools.
attributes.additional_details: We’d like to see changes to the rules of legislation requiring academy schools to be bound to local education authorities and not be able to ignore rules they do not want to adhere to. We’d also like all public schools admissions authorities decisions to admit a child to a school to be final and binding. Academy schools are only bound by decisions made solely by the Secretary of State for Education. This is a situation that allows schools to completely ignore local schools authorities and this must change.

attributes.action: Return the Road Fund Licence, back to weight of vehicle and NOT emissions.
attributes.background: Vehicle Road Fund licence was changed to a Green Tax with no public consultation.
attributes.additional_details: The Road Fund Licence or Car Tax as it is known was based on vehicle weight NOT emissions. It needs to be returned to this. The Government encouraged people to buy diesel cars, now they want them scrapped. That is not fair when diesels are more cost efficient. What puts more pollutants directly into the air? Air travel only been around for about 100 years but has done some damage.

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions for sickle cell anaemia patients
attributes.background: Incurable disease, it is a chronic blood disorder

attributes.action: To grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis.
attributes.background: The Home Office need to act to grant 6yr old epilepsy sufferer Alfie Dingley a licence for medical cannabis. He was treated with it in Holland and his seizures reduced from 150 to 1 seizure a month. Alfie should not have to break the law to access his medicine. He needs this medicine to live.
attributes.additional_details: Alfie is 1 of 9 of nine boys in the world who suffer from PCH19. Without this licence from the Home Office to use medicinal cannabis Alfie's seizures will return to over 150 a month each requiring hospitalisation. He will not have the quality of life he deserves. The only treatment he responds to in the UK causes psychosis, organ damage and early death. The family should not have to accept this. The licence should be granted, Alfie is a patient not a criminal. He needs access to his medicine.

attributes.action: To change the law, to regulate maintenance charges for leasehold properties.
attributes.background: Each of the 5 flats in my property are charged £1800 annually. Each segment of this bill is extortionate charges for which you can get alot cheaper. Now we have just found out that we need to raise £13,000 in 2 years for the roof.

attributes.action: That the government immediately and without strings give the NHS £10 Billion.
attributes.background: As a previous Dr it is obvious the "Winter Crisis" in the NHS is due directly to chronic under funding. Patients wait in A&E because of a lack of beds which have constantly reduced in number; not because of inappropriate attendances etc. Frontline NHS services need a direct increase in funding now!
attributes.additional_details: There are so many health professionals coming forward to argue this issue that no further references are really needed!

attributes.action: Supermarkets to be legally obliged to sell high sugar cereals separately.
attributes.background: Some breakfast cereals increasingly resemble confectionery, with many types having versions containing chocolate. Many contain between 20-39% sugar, are packaged to appeal to children, and are advertised on children’s TV. Meanwhile, childhood obesity rates continue to climb.
attributes.additional_details:
Many children consume over half their recommended daily amount of sugar at breakfast (Public Health England 2017). 
1in 5 British children finishes primary school obese (NHS 2017).
Typical supermarket Corn Flakes contain about 10% sugar.
Typical confectionery bars contain 45-50% sugar.
The govt. should make supermarkets legally obliged to sell those breakfast cereals containing 20-40% sugar separately, in the confectionery aisle, away from other breakfast cereals.

attributes.action: Free dental care for UK University Students whilst in full-time education
attributes.background: UK University students over the age of 19 currently have to pay for dental care. This is very expensive and students already have the burden of paying for rent, food, college material and travel. Paying an excessive amount for dental care is off-putting and deprives some from getting essential care.
